promise that. You don't know how Kutiizov is pestered since his appoint- ment as Commander in Chief. He told me himself that all the Moscow ladies have con- spired to give him all their sons as adjutants." 
"No, but do promise! I won't let you go! My dear benefactor . . ." 
"Papa," said his beautiful daughter in the same tone as before, "we shall be late." 
"Well, au revoir! Good-by! You hear her?" 
"Then tomorrow you will speak to the Em- peror?"
